cs.DC, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.AR, cs.SY 

This paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) category because it focuses on improving the performance of serverless computing, which is a type of cloud computing that involves distributed and parallel execution of short-lived functions. The paper also discusses the use of containers and sandboxing, which are common techniques in distributed computing. 

The Programming Languages (cs.PL) category is also likely because the paper proposes a new approach to optimizing serverless functions using a language-based sandboxing technique. The paper also mentions the use of Rust, which is a programming language known for its safety and performance features. 

The Software Engineering (cs.SE) category is another possibility because the paper discusses the challenges of optimizing serverless functions and proposes a new tool (Containerless) to address these challenges. The paper also evaluates the performance of Containerless using benchmarks, which is a common practice in software engineering research. 

The Architecture (cs.AR) category is a less likely possibility, but still plausible because the paper discusses the design and implementation of a new system (Containerless) for optimizing serverless functions. The paper also mentions the use of containers and sandboxing, which are architectural concepts.
